medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr P is experiencing progressively worsening memory issues and behavioral symptoms associated with dementia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Memory problems began 13 years ago, including forgetfulness about walking into a room and taking medications. Treatment was sought in 2004, with initial MMSE score of 29/30. By 2010, the score declined to 21/30, indicating mild progressive dementia. Symptoms included excessive napping, nighttime restlessness, and withdrawal from activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, lower extremity peripheral neuropathy, and coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Mr P is a 93-year-old bachelor who has lived alone with a cousin as the primary caregiver. He relies on the caregiver for managing 13 medications and instrumental activities. All other family members reside in Mexico.
